intro: Echites ferrugineus, commonly known as the rusty echites, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Echites ferrugineus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its drought tolerance.
